title: Paypal OTP Login Bug
content:
Hi,

Using FF 121.0.1 on a Windows 10 PC

For past few weeks whenever I try to purchase something via PayPal or login to PayPal, the One Time Password page is not rendering correctly, and not allowing me to continue. I have enclosed a capture of the issue.

For info, I can use PayPal without any issue on other browsers including Chrome and Brave.

title: Firefox seems to Limit Speeds to 300Mb/s when using any other website besides speedtest.net
content: Hi, I have a 1Gb/s symmetrical fiber. And when testing Google Chrome and Firefox, Firefox has a problem with uploading to most sites. But somehow it does with Speedtest.net. It's kinda weird tbh. Not to mention I have QoS enabled why the 600 and 700.

title: caricamento web site dopo accesso
content: il sito in question è: https://www.nike.com. Dopo aver inserito i dati di autentificazione (ID e password) il sito mi chiede di inserire un codice che mi viene inviato per email. Dopo aver inserito questo codice la pagina rimane bianca. Il problema si verifica solo in uno specifico PC, che si usi firefox, google chrome, etc.
creator: albertoagosti

title: Compatibility Issue Between Firefox and Intel Evo Laptop – Need Help!
content:
Hey Mozilla Support Community,

I hope you're all doing well. I'm reaching out because I've encountered a bit of a head-scratcher and was wondering if anyone else has experienced something similar.

I recently got myself an Intel Evo laptop, and while Chrome seems to be working seamlessly, I'm facing compatibility issues with Firefox. It's a bit puzzling, and I'm hoping to get some guidance from this knowledgeable community.

Here are the details of the issue:

Problem: I'm experiencing compatibility issues between Firefox and my Intel Evo laptop. The browser doesn't seem to be performing as smoothly as expected. Oddly, Chrome is working perfectly fine.

Symptoms:

Laggy performance when navigating websites. Occasional freezes and delays. General sluggishness compared to Chrome. What I've Tried: I've already tried a few troubleshooting steps:

Cleared the cache and cookies. Disabled unnecessary add-ons and extensions. Updated Firefox to the latest version. Checked for system updates on my Intel Evo laptop. System Information:


Firefox Version: 50 Operating System: window 10 I'm turning to this community in the hopes that someone might have encountered a similar issue or has insights into resolving compatibility concerns between Firefox and Intel Evo laptops. If you have any tips, suggestions, or if you've successfully addressed a similar problem, please share your knowledge!

Your help is much appreciated. Thanks in advance for your assistance!
creator: susanconner232

title: Firefox and Thunderbird installed, but not in usual place
content:
I have restored my Windows 10 Home (64), deleting all previous installed apps during the process. Hereafter Firefox and Thunderbird are downloaded and installed.

I did not find the 2 Apps in the usual program folder, and they do not appear in START->ALL APPS.

Searching my computer, I found Firefox and Thunderbird in these locations: Firefox: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_121.0.1.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root Thunderbird: "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\MozillaThunderbird.MZLA_115.6.0.0_x64__h5892qc0xkpca\VFS\ProgramFiles\MZLA Package Root\thunderbird.exe"

My question: is this the usual place or have I mixed things up during installation ?
creator: erlingagesen

title: Video playback freezing randomly and audio continues to play
content: The title describes the problem I'm facing. I don't really use other sites that have videos other than Youtube. But I notice that the videos freeze quite often and audio just continues to play. The videos then unfreeze and skip multiple frames. I've noticed clearing browser cache seems to help but it doesn't help for longer than a 2 min video at best. At worst, it doesn't affect it at all.
creator: tanishqsingh280607

creator: rfstev

title: Is it safe to save credit cards in Firefox on Linux?
content: Just recently I realized that the master password does not apply to credit card information. Firefox on Mac and Windows, if a login password exists, allows us to require authentication to autofill, view or edit saved credit cards. Firefox on Linux doesn't allow this authentication. So, I'm guessing that the credit card information is stored in Linux in an insecure manner. This is true? Another question about Mac and Windows. Does requiring authentication for credit card processes mean that the card information is encrypted on disk? Or does the password only protect information from unauthorized viewing, and the cards are stored on disks in text form?
creator: YDUBINSKY

title: iCloud Passwords not showing up in Autofill in Firefox.
content: On my phone, both passwords from Firefox and iCloud auto fill into my browser, but on Mac I do not see anything besides the Firefox ones. I keep my most up-to-date passwords in iCloud, but would love to use auto fill in Firefox as I am not a fan of Safari. Is there a way to set this up?
creator: katkaczmarski
